adrFormatAddress: 1585 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10028-4133, USA

originalText.text:
Fairly priced. Quick and easy grab n go snack.
I love the idea of grabbing a crepe the way you would a coffee. Probably faster service than your typical coffee shop too. I think i got my crepe in under five mins which is an important factor for someone like me who is always is late.
I have heard the staff is kind of rude. I didn‚Äôt experience a rude staff just a staff that seems shy or uncomfortable speaking in english as it seems to be a second language. As someone who has worked in the food industry for years id say they don‚Äôt owe us a fake smile. Get your crepe and keep it moving!
Will be back.

originalText.text:
Greedy little liars running the place now. I used to love this place because, while the crepes are hit-or-miss, the ones that are good are REALLY good, and they were always reasonably priced. My favorite is the pear, brie, and sugar, for $9. Soooooooo good.

I just went in, and the guy tried to charge me $14 for the pear, brie, and sugar crepe. A 55% price increase from just 2 weeks ago!

When I pointed this out, he lied to me and insisted it had never been $9, that it had always been "like $11 or $12. The price just went up a little." Dude stood there and lied right to my face.

I have pictures of the old menu with the old prices. I've included them here. So I can prove that the price was $9 on August 14 (when the photo was taken) and it remained $9 as recently as September 2nd (the last time I got crepes from them according to my credit card statement). That's less than 2 weeks ago (this incident happened on September 15).

I also noticed they have now removed all the prices from the current menu. So they can just charge whatever they feel like charging at the moment.

You know, if he had just posted new prices like an honest businessman, and told me, "Sorry, I know it's a big price increase, but we couldn't sustain the old prices" I would not be writing this review. I still wouldn't go back, but I wouldn't make it my mission to call him out publicly.

What makes me so angry is the dishonesty. This guy thinks he's real slick, erasing the prices from the menu so he can make them up on a whim at the register, and then SMILING AT ME while lying to my face about what the price used to be (that's called "duper's delight," by the way, when people smile while they're lying to you. It's because they're so pleased with themselves and their deceit).

He thinks he's real slick, ripping people off and treating us like we're too stupid to remember what we paid for something 2 weeks ago, but apparently it never occurred to him that some of us might have pictures proving his lies. Yeah, you're real slick, buddy. That's some top-tier scam artistry there.

I'm very disappointed that I won't be getting those delightful pear, brie, and sugar crepes anymore, but no crepe on earth is worth being played for a sucker by some amateur scam artist who thinks he's a criminal mastermind.

originalText.text:
I would give Bonjour crepes and wine infinite stars for the crepes alone. They are honestly some of the best crepes I've ever had.
Some of the staff here is the reason I'm giving 3 stars. (almost gave 2)
The attitude given every time I go in, is awful bordering on ridiculous. Whether dining in or taking out, it's the same nasty attitude. When they mess up my order (and I'm nice about it) it's the same gross attitude.
And it's not just me. (I'm not special üòè) The person who recommended this place to me, said the same exact thing to me when I brought it up to them. Knew exactly who I was talking about without even saying anything other than "what's with the attitude?"
I point this out because it's important and sad at the same time. The crepes are too good to not enjoy, but the nastiness really ruins the whole experience.
Now I just ignore that particular staff member.

originalText.text:
I NEVER ever leave a review, but my experience was negative two thumbs down across the board.  I ordered online and paid.  Today outside it is 7 degrees.  The address online said it was  15845 2nd Avenue.(94th and 2nd) only to find they closed the locations and how are on 82nd and 2nd.  I got a taxi and went there and went to pick up my order which should have been ready.  The person at the restaurant then chastised me and told me that my order was not ready because square does not talk to her system.  And I should have called.  Why on earth would I order online and then call when I paid and ordered online.

It‚Äôs a TOTAL scam because most people would NOT then go to the closed location and get a cab to pick up their food.  So the restaurant gets the revenue for an order that would likely not get picked up.  Thus when I showed up which was 10 minutes after the ‚Äúready time‚Äù, it was a SHOCK to hear, you‚Äôr food is not ready.

This place is not a place of integrity.  And so she made the crepes in 5 minutes and they are soggy and taste terrible.  Save your money and do not go to this place.

originalText.text: Have been coming here for years--the crepes taste great, particularly the savory ones. The price is normal for crepes (which are always going to be a pricey item, 8-15$). They use high quality ingredients that more than justify the cost!
